intro.description: Define a repository by using content assist.

item.title: Define the name of the repository
item.description: The name of the repository is used both to name produced output and as a label/name that is visible in tools that makes use of the repository.

subitem.label: Modify "repositoryName" to reflect the wanted name. The name can be fully qualified (e.g. org.myorg.myrepo). If you want a name that uses spaces or special characters, enclose the name in quotes (e.g. "My Ãœberfantastic Dream Repo").

item.title: Define the version of the repository
item.description: The version of the repository is used in file names of produced output as well as being used for normal version management tasks.

subitem.label: Modify "repositoryVersion" to reflect the version of the repository. Use 1.0.0 if you have no other preferences. This will use the default OSGi versioning scheme.
Press TAB to complete the template.
